sanskrit_verse:
न स्वामिना निसृष्टोऽपि शूद्रो दास्याद्विमुच्यते ।
निसर्गजं हि तत्तस्य कस्तस्मात्तदपोहति ॥ ८.४१४॥
transliteration:
na svāminā nisṛṣṭo'pi śūdro dāsyād vimucyate |
nisargajaṃ hi tattasya kastasmāt tadapohati || 8.414||
sph_interpretive_translation: Even when released by the master, a Śūdra does not become free from servitude; that which is born of his nature—who can remove it?
jurisprudential_principles: Capacity-based responsibility aligns with jāti-dharma (class-nature duties)
Restoration logic operates through alignment with svadharma
Consciousness alignment requires recognition of inherent role-dynamics
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent.isOfType('Śūdra') AND action.involves('claiming freedom from service') THEN enforce.recognitionOfInherentRole()
IF master.releases('Śūdra') AND societal.role.integrity.isThreatened THEN invoke.consciousnessRealignmentProtocol()
supreme_court_application: This axiom applies at the Supreme Court level where disputes arise regarding caste-based functional roles. The threshold of responsibility lies not in external coercion but in alignment with one's svabhāva. Authority flows from cosmic order, not personal assertion.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that nisarga defines svadharma. Anupūrvaśaḥ reveals sequential unfolding of duty based on birth-designated capacity. Responsibility is proportional to consciousness-readiness, not rebellion. There is no punitive consequence—only misalignment requiring realignment.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate svadharma-recognition process for involved parties
Reintegrate individual into structural harmony without shame or force
Restore integrity of role-dynamic through voluntary completion
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of all Dharma. Justice executed not through punishment but through restoration of natural order. Reality affirmed as non-punitive. Consciousness stands as ultimate adjudicator.
